intro: Anemone regina, commonly known as the imperial anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, single or double flowers with petal-like sepals that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has a short, fibrous root system and produces basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its natural habitat.
